header.title: People Over 40 Denied Free Samples in Social Experiment
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: Please consider supporting more content like this by becoming an AARP member: https://www.aarp.org/becomeamember. Three-fourths of older workers blame age discrimination for their lack of confidence in finding a new job. So we set up a fake business, giving out free gift baskets, to shine a spotlight on the barriers and ageist assumptions that older workers face in the job search. For more resources on age and the workplace visit: https://www.aarp.org/work/. Connect with AARP Online: Visit us: http://aarp.org. Like us on Facebook: http://facebook.com/AARP. Follow us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/AARP

commentThread.commentText: Age discrimination in the workplace is no joke. For more information and resources, visit www.aarp.org/work

commentThread.commentText:
It‚Äôs ironic our entire civilization from the books we read like Chaucer to Bacon to Aristotle to Jane Austin were prepared by individuals who had decades of experience.  

What ageism is about is simply employers looking to hire cheaper and cheaper staff in a concerted race to the bottom.   

Uber destroyed the Taxi industry taking full time work for people of different backgrounds and turning it into gig work with no stability and benefits.  All of the business risk is shifted to the drivers.   

How does it feel that every worker has been turned into a commodity?  We are no more than cogs in a machine.  

The reason I referenced some greats in civilization is simple.  People don‚Äôt get worse with age they get better.

I hope the people rejected were tracked down and told this was a social experiment.  It would be awful to ruin a persons day.  People have different emotional states and circumstances.  Don't want to send someone over the edge from a learning experiment.

And I was  not so privilege that I had two legs that worked and I could get my own food. She was doing us a favor and to respect her for it. I am in my 50s. I took my mom out to eat recently and saw a customer who was over 50 in the parking lot yelling how she was going to get her waitress ( a young girl)fired for being so slow. The place was PACKED. commentThread.commentText: AARP where profits are #1

I was unemployed for a bit. Found a job that didn't pay enough and worked until I found another that turned out to be the job from Hell. I almost cried every day while driving to work but stuck it out for 5 months without calling off until I found a job I love. I was blessed that my new boss actually preferred older workers because they are reliable, less likely to play on their phones while working, more accepting of constructive criticism, don't usually collapse under pressure and would never even consider asking for a mental health day! Older workers know how to work hard, don't need constant affirmation and have enough life & work experience to handle most unusual situations.

I am a RN was working for a company, that was about Youth, the employee was also anxious about something, heavy drinkers and took off work often. I was let go, not because "I was a bad RN, I just didn't fit their company" haha, because I showed up for my work and did my job. I think one of the young RN supervisors couldn't handle my work ethic, don't like someone that makes them look bad. I had another job by end of week. üòÇ

commentThread.commentText: I read a lot of these posts. the truth is, it's all about the money. that's the employment market folks.

replies.commentText: Not sure how age discrimination can be about money. An older worker is less likely to call off, ask for mental health days and is more likely to have enough experience to be more productive.

It‚Äôs about healthcare premiums that companies are having to pay to carry insurance for their employees. If you keep the risk pool at a younger average age, you can reduce the cost of these premiums. Additionally, there are high level executives who are dead weight and they will not retire and they‚Äôre never fired or laid off because they‚Äôre locked into the buddy system. They have friends that are doing the same and they are all protecting each other.  The lowest common denominator is the low level employee and they are being compromised.

@LN B sad, to keep incompetent emplyees because they're young instead of hiring employees with knowledge and experience who could actually do the job and do it well and right. Very short sighted. My Mother would call them penny wise and pound foolish. They're watching their health care pennies while their customer satisfaction plummets. Great way to lose customers!

That is not right so Shut up ü§¨üò†
Wow!

Age discrimination also comes into play when it comes to just being friends.  The sad truth is, no one under 20..or 30..or 40 (pick your favorite number, doesnt matter) wants to have anything to do with anyone outside of their immediate peer circle. They feel they dont have anything in commmon; they dont fit in, they dont belong.
But the reality is, thats not how society works. When you go out into the world, you will find that a community is made up of all different kinds of people, from various backgrounds, ages, races, etc.
If we are to survive in this life, we all need to learn to work together and help one another. If we approached civilization as we did personal relationships, society would be strictly segregated into countless groups, each with a common thread and strong divisions keeping us apart. And it will eventually lead to our demise.

Sad that this happens still today, it‚Äôs not only in the workplace, it‚Äôs in social interactions as well. 

If someone accepts you are close to their age in dating for example but then they find out otherwise, many people will still reject you (even though at first they liked and accepted you). These is crazy to me, because it completely overlooks who we are as an individuals, and instead puts you in a biased preconceived narrow little box.

I interviewed with a machine shop and when taken to the CNC machine they needed run, lo and behold "James" was on it....the exact same guy I trained on the exact same machine at National Oilwell before the big layoff...
I setup their grapple cell and trained everyone after going thru every machine brought in, parts, tooling and programs....
I was told by this company "I didn't meet their qualifications"...
Been doing this for 45 years......

First let me say I probably fit into the older category. I‚Äôm 49 - yikes. Now let me play devil‚Äôs advocate... I work in a large office. We have all ages. I know lots of millennials who are great workers. I also know older workers who are just waiting to retire and who also refuse to learn new things and some who can‚Äôt learn new things. So... there‚Äôs good and bad to each side.

commentThread.commentText: The work place doesn't tell the young 20 year olds to be mean and nasty  but they reward all of them a lot more than the people that are older than 40. So in a since they are telling them to be ugly towards us and mistreat us! So how would they feel if they had to deal with  being bullied and played tricks on, on a daily basis! These girls were all new coming out of a new class/ just graduated and we're making more money than me and I had never gotten really much of a raise!  At the end trying to get a review of how I was doing and the girls were all so mean and constantly on their phones playing games watching movies going outside on breaks a lot and were acknowledged in meetings, where was i in the back and invisible when I was working I was the one that was running to get the call lights! CNA work is one of the hardest, backstabbing jobs out there! And the bosses could careless about a person who's  trying harder to, to help make life better! üò≥Yes, anyone would be angry with a  situation like that.!!!üò°‚òπ  making not even close enough to live on and have thought about going some where people are making  15 or 20 dollars and don't even work that hard! Life was not meant to be slaved for other people benefits and making the same amount of money with in 25 year's  is not okay!

replies.commentText: You should definitely look for another job! One where they'll appreciate your hard work. The best thing will be when you leave for a better job and they'll suddenly realize who did most of the work. They will be like little lost lambs!

Blanche Konieczka ~ I did leave last June  and the 5 star's  thing that's on line when you look at there  website went from 4 1/2 stars to 1 1/2 stars!  It's awful and some of the residents that had been there were leaving before I left but I really  loved them and they loved me! I took care of them like they were my grandmas and grandpa's!  I actually knew a handful of them from church and from when I was in middle/ Jr. High school and  Elementary School.  So they were very close to my heart and the bosses seem to only care about their paychecks and getting home to their parties or get togethers!   Once years before we had two bosses that were at the same place but they left because of how they were being treated. Those bosses we had were caring and cared about the nurses and CNA's and they would come in, in the middle of the night to help do the CNA work  or nurses jobs but the new bosses would not even answer their phone's!  I should have reported them but  everyone knows everyone in town so I didn't want to go down that road. One of my friends that's an RN  had a job for me but I broke my left foot in two places and it took a long time to heal and I'm still limping to this day. I love people but dislike drama from any age person like I was dealing with!  Yes I'm trying to do my own P.T. by myself  to strengthen my foot! I'm telling everyone if you know you've broken any bones in your foot then get to the doctor or hospital right away don't listen to anyone. I had to go 7 weeks with the broken bones and no one was listening to me till I got ex-rays on my foot.  Going to a podiatrist is much cheaper than a hospital and they can tell you what you need.   Thank you for caring.

@Jennifer Vieira God bless you for caring for the residents as if they were family! The job from Hell was cooking in a nursing home and a handful of us cared about the residents but nobody else did. I was often close to tears when I had to cook and serve tiny portions of substandard food. My new job is cooking at Little Sisters of the Poor where their motto is "Making the residents happy". They really live by this motto and I've never loved a job more. I'll pray for your foot to heal and for you to find a job you love and where you're appreciated. You deserve the best!

@Blanche Konieczka ~ Aww, Thank you for praying for me! I really need healing for the left over pain to disappear so I'm not limping. You sounds like a sweet heart and yes, the place where I was at was kind of doing the same thing with portions sizes. It made me so sad and up set! I don't like saying anything bad about a place but they were going down hill but after I left I kept seeing notifications that they were hiring all the time like they couldn't keep cna's.  It's  just to bad because  my mom's friends and  my friends that all work either in the hospital or doctor offices and so people  I don't know all said that the assistant living company's I are all going down hill. They don't treat their better employees  good and don't care about what may what to them at work.  I need some type of job where I can sit down and also be able to get up.  Maybe a computer job!  I need to also work on my skills for that.
@Jennifer Vieira will add to my prayer for you to find a job that you love. Praying now

@Jennifer Vieira 
‚úî Damn, I should have taken that speed reading class

@Blanche Konieczka ~ Thank you,  I did love caring for the elderly but it was like I have a curse on me and I never can make anything more than $10.00 an hour my whole life. That's everywhere I go.  And I'm  about to go to the library to get two books on P.T. for my foot to strengthen it I make it strong again after breaking it in two places. I'm finding that very tiring which worries me and I need a gym to help me get my foot stronger again!  I'm just in a catch 22 with no job and needing to work out.

@Jennifer Vieira you'll find a way. May I make a suggestion that might seem strange? Give it to God, put your trust in Him and He will provide. I was the head chef and kitchen manager in a job at an independent living facility and I adored my job. My company lost the contract and I was asked to stay by the facility but the way they took the contract away was sneaky, underhanded and just downright mean to my bosses. I declined because my bosses had become my friends and you don't stab your friends in the back. Was unemployed for 7 months. Didn't understand why because I have the skills, I rarely call off, my bosses gave me great references and I have a lot of experience. Realized it was my age, I'm over 60. I ran out of unemployment and used up my tiny savings. While driving home from my sister's one day I was praying for help and began to cry. I thought, I've done all I can. Put in applications almost daily for the past month, updated my resume and sent a customized cover letter with every application. There's nothing else I can do so it's in God's Hands. Then I prayed again, giving it to God, putting my trust in Him. Felt better and actually stopped worrying knowing the Lord had my back. Within 2 days I had 3 job offers! Ended up taking a nursing home job and when a new company took over and cut my hours, I went to another nursing home and it was the job from Hell. Used to ask God why He sent me to 2 places that didn't work out, but I persevered. Stuck it out for five months then finally found my dream job working for a charity feeding the elderly poor. They hired me because I had nursing home experience! God knew what He was doing! It all started when I put all of my trust in Him. Every time I'd start to worry I'd tell myself, God's got this and my fear and worry would slowly vanish. I'll keep praying for you! There's a line from a song on KLove, "Trust in the Lord and never give up hope, you're gonna do great things I already know. God's got His Hand on so don't live your life in fear, forgive and forget but don't forget why you're here.

commentThread.commentText: I am 59 but look about 30 according to everyone I know. Because of this I am told several times a week I can't have a senior discount.

replies.commentText: Easy fix‚ÄîShow your license!

commentThread.commentText: The woman that got laid off needs to examine herself. If you look like a mess, people are going to think that you're a mess. It's also been proven that older men/women are slower mentally than younger individuals. 60+ < 30 and below.

The woman who is 60 & got laid off need's to take a good look at herself in the mirror. She need's her hair done & need's some glasses that aren't the type generally given to institutionalized people/Prison & Psych patients. Also, a good attitude might help instead of complaining...she might ask what she might do to get a more positive response. I had an employer once that treated their people like family. They might ask to use your car to go to lunch or go look at a new car for them...so they knew how the people who worked for them would be treated. The vehicle at the very least would come back with an oil change and a full tank of gas or maybe new tires. No, I'm not joking. I once was called into the office and the owners were there with arm's crossed & said that they had been watching me...OK, I'm in the office...!! They said that they still couldn't figure out how I was able to tell someone where to go with such elegance and have them smile and agree with me while I was doing it. Had many other wonderful experiences and Never got fired or laid off from a job in my lifetime

replies.commentText: Little Bit ...seriously??? Was she applying for a job in this video? I think not.

She was complaining about the situation and the point is you never know who you might really be talking to. She went on video & poor me....!! Case & point.. I have been offered jobs at jobs I've been working at.. I'd be given a business card and be offered new employment. Another situation is when I was at a small local store years ago and & couple came in from the lake. The man in swimming trunks and I think her in a swim suit & cover up, I don't know if they had shoe's on or not, but it's where people live on the water. The cashier got snotty with them and I was behind them. The cashier was telling me that she had a job interview the next day and she would be so happy that she wouldn't have to work there anymore. The couple she was so rude to paid for their things. The man looked at the cashier and told her that he was the owner of the company she was supposed to have the interview with & she just failed/she didn't need to go because she failed!!! That's the point.

commentThread.commentText: Youth is venerated by marketing agencies in most advertisement for one primary reason. The young are more likely to spend less wisely, and therefore have more available disposable income. This trickles down to a general distorted perception in society. This btw is unique to western culture, where newer is always perceived as better. This idea has lead us to become a more and more vacuous society. Most now value characters, as opposed to having character. The Kardashians being famous for no reason is a prime symptom.
